articles.description: Henon bamboo flowers only once every 120 years then vanishes for years, and researchers have no idea how it comes back to life.
articles.content:
A shoot of henon bamboo (Phyllostachys nigra var. henonis) before flowering.  (Image credit: Paul Starosta/Getty Images)
An unusual species of bamboo is about to flower for the first time in over 10… [+3370 chars]
